review_blob: Dark orange-amber w/ auburn hue. Pillowy, off-white finger of foam. Fresh, breezy, citrusy aroma w/ an underlying sweetness. Creamy feel, but the alcohol numbs in the finish. Flavour profile has potential--it is sufficiently earthy & bitter--but alcohol dominates the finish, giving the beer slightly unpleasant, medicinal quality. A relatively decent brew.
beer_name: Flying Monkeys Hoptical Illusion Almost Pale Ale

review_blob: Pours a slightly hazy, highly carbonated, orange-amber w/ an initial voluminous off-white head that dissipated relatively quickly. Aroma is musty & vinous w/ some citrus & wood-like notes. Light, effervescent feel. Flavour is tart & acidic w/ a dry, almost leathery finish.
Clear. dark, gold w/ quickly dissipating off-white head. Mildly metallic hoppy aroma. Thick, creamy feel. Some grassy-graininess up front, w/ a dry, tobacco-like, bitter finish.
Darkish, hazy orange-amber w/ thin off-white head. Aroma is sweet (caramel) w/ fruity notes.  Medium-to-light feel. Flavour is moderately sweet w/ a mild, dry bitterness in the finish.

Black w/ frothy ring of brown foam. Aroma of burnt(-in-a-good-way) coffee, dark chocolate, & earthy, herbal hops w/ notes of dried fruit. Thick, chewy, creamy feel. Rich, complex flavour of roasted malts w/ some nicely bitter, earthy hops in the finish.
beer_name: Scotch Irish Tsarina Katarina Imperial Stout

review_blob: Clear amber w/ a few gray bubbles. Sweet aroma w/ some fusel notes. syrupy feel. Sweet flavour of caramel & brown sugar w/ an extremely intense, malt liquor-like alcohol presence.
Dark amber w/ small ring of gray foam. Sweet, malty, boozy aroma w/ some notes of dried fruit. Thick, syrupy feel. Very sweet & malty w/ a strong alcohol presence.

Black w/ frothy ring of brown foam. Aroma of espresso & dark chocolate w/ notes of vanilla, hazelnut, cherry & ginger. Medium feel. Flavour is rich & sweet (vanilla, chocolate) w/ a bitter, earthy hop finish & a grapefruity dryness.

beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Corne du Diable

review_blob: Sampled at Volo during Cask Days 2006. Notes entered in 2008 . . . go figure! Anyway, pours a cloudy dark-orange amber w/ frothy ring of foam. Big, juicy grapefruit aroma w/ notes of tobacco & pine. Thick, sticky feel. Very big, very bitter, earthy flavour w/ solid backbone of caramel & toffee.
beer_name: Scotch Irish Admiral Perry Imperial IPA

review_blob: 2005 Vintage. Cloudy amber-brown w/ some sediment. Generous finger of creamy beige foam. Aroma is malty (caramel, brown sugar) & brandy-ish w/ some fine herbal hops. full-bodied, chewy feel. Flavour is moderately complex, sweet & malty w/ notes of dried fruit & fresh hops.
Clear amber w/ small finger of pale tan foam. Mild aroma of herbal hops & caramel. Medium feel. Sweet malty flavour of caramel w/ a lightly bitter hoppiness.

Pours dark brown almost black w/ solid finger of creamy brown foam. Sweet aroma of dark chocolate, cream, cherry, vanilla, bourbon, oak, & treacle. Soft, creamy feel. Flavour is sweet, rich, somewhat roasty but also tart & tannic--from the cherries & oak I suppose. Finish is warm and bourbon-like (surprise). Quite nice.
beer_name: Bells Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: Pours a cloudy yellow-amber w/ carbonated burst of white foam that settles quickly. Some sediment. Soft, rounded, musty, vinous aroma of tannins, grapes, lemony citrus, & oak w/ notes of honey & caramel. Feel is light, astringent, & carbonated. Flavour sour & dry w/ a lingering tartness.

On tap at the Eccentric Cafe. Medium amber-brown w/ beige foam. Sweet , malty, grainy, mildly toasty aroma w/ some herbal notes. Lightly carbonated feel. Flavour is sweet w/ some light, bitter herbal notes. Straight forward and quaffable.
Opaque orange-amber w/ ring of beige foam. fresh, hoppy, grapefruit aroma. Thick, resiny feel. Sweet malty flavour w/ a bitter, grapefruity finish.
Dark amber w/ light brown ring of foam. Sweet, spicy aroma of brown sugar & cinnamon w/ background of roasty malts. Sweet, syrupy feel. Well-balanced flavour w/ a bitter, peppery finish.

Pours a slightly hazy amber w/ a good-size pale tan head. Aroma is sweet, showing caramel & nutty hops. Soft, creamy feel. Flavour is sweet, though somewhat bland, & generally clean, though some mild fusel notes come through in the finish.
Clear yellow /w thin finger of white foam. Very sweet, green apple soda aroma. Spritzy feel. Artificial apple flavour w/ a very mild tartness & some breadiness underneath.
Dark yellow w/ small white head. Aroma of sweet honey w/ floral notes. Light, syrupy feel. Dry, spicy honey flavour that warms a little in the finish.
beer_name: Church-Key Riders of the Purple Loosestrife

review_blob: Cloudy gold w/ pale tan finger of foam. Yeasty, bready aroma w/ notes of ginger, coriander & toffee. Light, syrupy feel. Somewhat bland, malty flavour of bread & cereal w/ mild notes of caramel & toffee.
Clear amber w/ thin finger of light beige foam. Malty, earthy aroma w/ notes of wood, tobacco, & tea. Light feel. Malty flavour of caramel & licorice / some burnt, woody notes.
beer_name: Great Lakes Brewing Devils Pale Ale 666

review_blob: Clear pale gold w/ large white head. Aroma is fruity & mildly grainy. Light, juicy feel. Clean, grainy flavour w/ a light hop bitterness.

beer_brewer_name: La Face Cache de la Pomme
review_blob: Clear golden-amber w/ no carbonation. Aroma of sweet apples, cheese, & brandy. Juicy, syrupy feel.. Apple pie & cheddar cheese flavour w/ a mild tartness & warm, brandyish finish.
beer_name: La Face Cache de la Pomme Neige Premire

review_blob: Highly carbonated, pale yellow appearance w/ quickly dissipating white foam (looked like soda). Sweet, malty, work-like flavour. Watery feel. Sweet, slightly astringent flavour.
Pale gold w/ fizzy, white finger of foam. Grainy,  malty, wort-like aroma. Watery feel. Harsh, extremely sweet flavour.
Pale gold w/ frothy white foam.  Sweet, grassy aroma. Watery feel. Flavour is very bland w/ a hint of sweetness & bitter, metallic notes in the finish.

Hazy yellow-gold w/ a lovely finger of white foam. Good lacing. Fresh aroma of citrus & pine  Light, mildly sticky feel. Clean, fresh hop flavour w/ a delicate sweetness. Finish is relatively quick, but refreshing & sufficiently bitter.

Dark brown-mahogany w/ a light brown finger of foam. Very smokey, roasty campfire aroma w/ hints of coffee, chocolate & caramel. Thick, chewy feel.  Flavour is smokey & very sweet w/ notes of coffee, caramel, chocolate, licorice, & raisin.

Clear orange-amber w/ a thin ring of beige foam. Strong maraschino cherry aroma w/ very mild hint of wheat & honey. Thin, watery, carbonated feel. Bland, wheaty flavour w/ an unpleasant mineral bitterness. Blah.
Cloudy gold w/ a small ring of white foam. Sweet aroma of wheat, bubblegum, & banana. Light, slightly creamy feel. Relatively bland wheat flavour w/ a quick, clean finish.
Slightly cloudy yellow w/ thin white ring of foam. Light grapefruit & biscuity malt aroma. Medium, syrupy feel. Malty flavour w/ some light notes of  corn & citrusy hops.
Cloudy amber w/ thin, pale tan finger of foam. Sweet aroma of caramel w/ some very light grassy hops. Thin feel. Very bland, mildly caramel flavour w/ little to no bitterness.
Syrupy pale gold w/ almost no bubbles. Aroma of tart apples, pie crust & brandy. Syrupy feel. Nice apple pie flavour w/ a mild acidic tartness that comes through in the finish.
Dark amber w/ finger of beige foam. Sweet malty aroma w/ notes of caramel, chocolate, dried figs, & raisins. Medium feel. Sweet, malty flavour w/ some roasty notes.

Very dark brown w/ frothy ring of light brown foam. Sweet, chocolaty aroma notes of espresso, lactose, licorice, & toasted nuts. Full-bodied feel. Sweet flavour of creamy milk chocolate & light coffee. Dry, mildly earthy, somewhat tobacco-y finish
Cloudy yellow-amber w/ off-white ring of frothy foam. Hoppy aroma of citrus (orange, tangerine) w/ background of caramel & toffee. Sticky feel. Balanced, malty flavour w/ a semi-sweet finish.

Black w/ brown bubbles. Smokey, roasty aroma of espresso & dark, bitter chocolate w/ notes of licorice. Thick, creamy feel. Flavour is roasty w/ a sweet underlying chocolaty, butterscotch maltiness. Finish is mildly smokey.
Dark brown w/ brown ring of foam. Roasty aroma of strong coffee & bitter, dark chocolate. Full-bodied feel. Sweet, mocha-coffee flavour w/ some light astringent notes.

Cloudy amber w/ creamy finger of pale tan foam. Nice lacing. Fresh, hoppy, grapefruit nose. Sticky feel. Well-balanced, complex flavour w/ a sweet caramel & toffee maltiness & a citrusy hoppy bitterness. Finish is dry & peppery.
beer_name: Avery The Maharaja Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: Cloudy amber w/ frothy finger of pale tan foam. Big, hoppy (grapefruit) aroma w/ a solid malt foundation (caramel, toffee) & notes of vanilla. Sticky, juicy feel. Surprisingly sweet, malty flavour w/ a juicy hop bitterness.

Very dark amber w/ light brown finger of foam. Aroma of milk chocolate & dried fruit w/ some roasty, caramel notes. Creamy feel. Rich, sweet fruitcake flavours, but finish is a little to dry & alcohol laden.
Pours a ruddy amber w/ a large, creamy head of pink-beige foam. Fresh raspberry aroma w/ woody notes. Medium, spritzy feel. Tart raspberry flavour w/ underlying woody, nutty notes.
2006 Vintage. Hazy amber w/ creamy finger of pale tan foam. Spicy aroma of nutmeg, ginger, cinnamon, orange peel & vanilla. Soft, creamy feel. Flavour is spicy & tangy w/ an oily, peppery finish.
beer_name: Hitachino Nest New Year Celebration Ale

review_blob: Brown w/ a warm burgundy glow & a dark beige finger of foam. Aroma of fresh roasted coffee & milk chocolate aroma w/ vanilla & licorice notes. Soft, thick feel. Dry, well-balanced flavour w/ an earthy, bitter finish.

Slightly cloudy orange-copper w/ fluffy, pillowy tan head. Fresh, floral aroma w/ some grainy malts underneath. Medium, mildly creamy feel. Tangy, caramel flavour w/ dry, moderately bitter finish. A surprising offering from Sleeman.
beer_name: John Sleeman Presents India Pale Ale

review_blob: 2002 Vintage. Thick, syrupy, clear gold. Aroma of apples, pie crust, & cream w/ notes of charred wood. Thick, honeyish feel. Sweet apple sauce flavour w/ dry, peppery alcohol in the finish. Not as complex as the aroma suggests but pleasant nonetheless.
beer_name: Domaine Pinnacle Cidre de Glace - Ice Cider

review_blob: Clear gold w/ a white ring of foam. Aroma of honey & caramel malts w/ grassy & floral notes. Light, slightly buttery feel. Flavour is honeyish & sweet w/ mild, spicy hops in the finish.
Dark amber w/ beige finger of foam. Aroma is smoky, roasty, & malty (caramel, toffee). Thin feel. Flavour is sweet & buttery w/ some light roasted, smoky notes. Overall flavour is surprisingly bland.

Cloudy yellow-gold w/ lots of sediment & a huge, rocky white head. Soft, floral aroma w/ an interesting yeastiness as well as light citrus & barnyard notes. Light, creamy feel. Rich, wheaty,  grainy flavour w/ a dry, tea-like hop bitterness. Very interesting indeed.
